subject: Communication
title: Hofstede's Cultural Dimensions
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Hofstede's Cultural Dimensions.

hook.text: Geert Hofstede surveyed 116,000 IBM employees across 72 countries. He found that culture could be measured on six axes.

buildup.text: His six dimensions: Power Distance, Individualism, Masculinity, Uncertainty Avoidance, Long-Term Orientation.

discovery.text: Each dimension is a spectrum. Every country scores differently, creating a unique cultural fingerprint.

twist.text: Hofstede's model is powerful but imperfect â€” it treats nations as uniform and ignores subcultures, generations, and.

climax.text: Despite its limits, the framework gave global businesses their first systematic language for discussing cultural.

punchline.text: Culture can't be measured perfectly. But it can be mapped usefully.

quiz.question: How many cultural dimensions did Hofstede identify?
